title: A compaint about me was "verified". Where do I find the evidence? I assert that I did nothing wrong.
body: I don't appreciate accusations without evidence. Riot used to send an email with the text that was punishable. Where is that now? I want proof that this was verified by a human being. And then I want to understand what that person was thinking.

replies.body: Logging into the client will show you a reform card. I tried to check for you, but you must be speaking about a different account.

If you are punished by the Instant Feedback System for chat offenses you will receive a Reform Card in your client upon logging in which shows 1-3 games of your own chat logs that contributed to the punishment. If you're interested in discussing the punishment I recommend posting that here.

If you did not receive that, then you weren't punished by the IFS, and to get more information about it you should submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

A note that the reform card for chat restrictions is shown one time halfway through the restriction. If someone skips through it or hadn't reached halfway, they'll need to contact support for their logs.

Edit I'm wrong
This isn't how it works. It will show up as soon as you are restricted, and also every time you relog as long as the restriction is active.
Really? It didn't for me before. Maybe I missed the change or it bugged for me. Thanks for the clarification
Huh? Reform cards pop up when you log in until the restriction is over. I haven't seen anywhere that this has changed.
Was just going based on my personal experience, but maybe I'm thinking long long ago or it bugged on me somehow.
Logging in normally shows you the details.
Bans are AUTOMATED until you're on the last tier (permaban) then your case will be monitored.. If I'm right
Nope, permabans are completely automated too.
